definition: to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to

sentences.english: I ignored the sign and started to cross.
sentences.chinese: 我不理會牌子，開始趟水。

sentences.english: The United Nations Security Council approved a joint cease-fire resolution.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國安理會通過了一個聯合停火決議。

sentences.english: She doesn't end the mask stuck to Comus' chair.
sentences.chinese: 她並未理會粘在科瑪斯座椅上的面具。

sentences.english: Soc. The good are to be regarded, and not the bad?
sentences.chinese: 好的觀點應該去重視，而不好的就不用理會？

sentences.english: Ep560 - Old Madam Hong tries to persuade Zhizhong stop his evil deeds, but Zhizhong ignores her.
sentences.chinese: 洪老太苦口婆心勸志忠勿再做壞事，但志忠不加理會。

sentences.english: According to reports, Cambodian foreign ministers will attend the 14th meeting of the Council.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，泰柬兩國外長將出席14日的安理會會議。

sentences.english: Just heart flagged tired, I don't want to ignore all. Take inventory.
sentences.chinese: 只是心倦了，不想再理會所有的是是非非。

sentences.english: Sarah and I politely ignored her brother.
sentences.chinese: 薩拉和我沒再理會她哥哥。

sentences.english: Mr. Obama is the first U.S. president to chair a summit-level meeting at the council.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬是主持安理會峯會級會議的首位美國總統。

sentences.english: He ignored shouts begging him to stop and sign autographs.
sentences.chinese: 他絲毫不理會粉絲求他停下來簽名的喊叫聲。

sentences.english: China supports the holding of this high-level Security Council meeting on counter piracy off the coast of Somalia.
sentences.chinese: 中國支持安理會就索馬里海盜問題召開高級別會議。

sentences.english: Let go of the spokes. Live in the center. That is the real.
sentences.chinese: 不去理會輪輻，安住在中心，那纔是真實的。

sentences.english: Bush and Blair later failed to obtain security council authorisation.
sentences.chinese: 布什和布萊爾後來未能獲得安理會授權。

sentences.english: Lacroix said other nations on the Security Council expressed a similar position.
sentences.chinese: 拉克魯瓦說，安理會其他成員國也表達了類似的立場。

sentences.english: Is a divided Security Council really any use?
sentences.chinese: 被分裂的安理會還有何用？

definition: to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
